moves.1. f4 c5 2. Nf3 g6 3. e3 Bg7: Slow opening... but the agame heats up l;ater!
moves.4. d3 e6 5. Be2 Ne7 6. O-O Nbc6: Black postpones castling for the moment. In a closed game, getting your King to safety immediately is of less import.
moves.7. e4 d6 8. c3 O-O 9. Be3 Rb8: White has King-side ambitions, while Black plays for a Queen-side push.
moves.10... f5: Black counters with an aggressive strike.
moves.11. e5 cxd4 12. cxd4 Nd5: Stalling White's central advance and centralizing the Knight.
moves.15. dxe5: White does not fall into the trap.
moves.15... b5 16. Nc3 Qb6+: Black attempts to seize the initiative.
moves.17. Kg2 Rd8 18. Nxd5 Rxd5: Black presses forward. White must defend carefully.
moves.22. Rfd1: White tries to break the force of the attack via exchanging pieces.
moves.22... Ne7 23. Rac1 Qb6 24. Rxd5 Nxd5: The attack has been blunted. Both sides maintain winning chances.
moves.25. Qxb5: If Black is foolish enough to play 25...QxQ?? White has 26 BxQ RxB 27 RxBch, with a Pawn up ant the attack.
moves.25... Qe3: This move offers White a chance to draw with 26 Q-K8ch K-N2 27 R-B7ch. If White takes the Rook, however...
moves.26. Qxb8: White does take the Rook! A risky decision, but White is confident she can keep her defenses intact.
moves.26... Qxe2+ 27. Kh3: White attempts to induce Black into 27...NxPch???. If Black falls for this, 28 K-R4!!! wins [28...N-N7ch 29 K-N5 Q-K6ch 30 K-B6, with 31 QxP following as a deadly threat.] If Black plays 27...QxN, equalizing the material, White has 28 RxBch!!! K-N-2 29 R-N8ch K-R3 30 RxPch!!! forcing mate.
moves.27... Kg7: Black avoids both the fatal lines in the previous note. A fine response.
moves.28. Qxa7+: White must press the attack. If she moves the Knight instead of this move, 28...NxPch is fatal.
moves.28... Kh6 29. Qa3: Guarding the Knight and threatening 30 K-R4!!!, followed by 31 Q-B8 mate.
moves.29... Kh5: A spectacular riposte. Now Black threatens 30...B-R3 and 31...Q-B8ch.
moves.30. Re1: One player finally falters. White should have played 30 R-KN1!! instead. A well-deserved draw would result from 30 R-KN1!! P-N4!! 31 PxP B-R3 32 P-N4ch PxPch 33 RxP Q-KB7! 34 R-R4ch K-N3 35 R-R6ch K-N2 36 QxB QxNch.
moves.32. Qd1 Ne3 33. Rxe3 Bf1+: White resigns, as mate is forced.
